cleaned_text: Research In order to have "real freedom", a person needs to have the "substantive opportunity to do or be something". But what does "substantive" exactly mean in that definition? In our chapter for the Handbook of Equality of Opportunity, Morten Byskov, Sebastian Östlund, and I analyze the notion of "substantiveness" and demonstrate with various case studies how it can be interpreted.
